greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^4 mod 6.
comment: a(n) = A070431(n). Proof: n^4-n^2 == 0 (mod 6) is shown explicitly for n = 0..5, then the induction n -> n+6 for the 4th order polynomial followed by binomial expansion of (n+6)^k concludes that the zero (mod 6) is periodically extended to the other integers. -  _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 23 2009
Equivalently: n^(2*m + 4) mod 6; n^(2*m + 2) mod 6. - _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 01 2016
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,1)
program: (Sage) [power_mod(n,4,6) for n in range(0, 101)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Oct 30 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 13 2002
